CUSTOMER SERVICE REPRESENTATIVE

SUMMARY

My favorite part of working is being able to interact with people.
I love to provide Customer Service and provide the best experience with the company.
My personal experiences have made me realize I like to make a call or a store visit  more worthwhile for the customer. My purpose is make what can be a boring or tedious task to be a better experience and make a happy and loyal customer.
I mainly have worked in call centers and a little experience in sales and store customer service.
Highlights
High customer service standards
Computer skills in power point, word, autocadd, chief architect, word spreadsheet, some Excel, internet, and intranet.
Dedicated to process improvement Conflict resolution proficiency Devoted to data integrity Troubleshooting skills Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite
Bilingual in Spanish Proficient in reading and writing in spanish Strong writing skills and comprehension in both English and Spanish

ACCOMPLISHMENTS

Managed call flow with up to  200+ calls in queue per minute.
Exceeded corporate target for customer satisfaction for  2-3 months in a row several times.
Earned cash bonuses for Customer Satisfaction several times

<JD_START>
Job Title: Installation Service Technician

Location: Syracuse, NY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
General Overview: TotalKare of America, Inc. is a leading healthcare security systems integrator located in Syracuse, New York. Our core competency for almost 30 years has been the design, integration, implementation and maintenance of electronic security systems in nursing homes, hospitals, independent living and assisted living facilities throughout the Northeast. Systems include infant and wander protection, emergency response, fall detection, nurse call, access control, CCTV and other customized solutions. We are a family owned business and an equal opportunity employer. Please visit our website at www.totalkare.com to learn more about our company. We are seeking career minded individual with a strong work ethic and dedication to serve our customer base. Most work will be performed in a healthcare setting among nursing staff, patients and residents requiring discretion, professionalism and a respectful attitude at all times. This position requires travel Monday through Friday with overnight stays required, as we cover all of New York State, Long Island, parts of New Jersey and New England.  Responsibilities/Duties and Expectations:Install equipment as directed by the Project Manager. Includes running cable, mounting and testing equipment.Service and maintain existing system(s) to ensure that all assigned service calls are handled from start to finish in a timely manner.Prepare/update documentation such as wiring diagrams, floorplans and location functionality and forward them to the Project Manager and office.Communicate with customers regarding ETA and status at all times.Communicate with dispatch regarding status, progress and resolution of assigned service calls.Weekend service calls, although infrequent, may be required (with compensation.)Qualified Candidate “Must-Haves”:Low voltage circuitry and testing experience.Computer hardware, software & network skills (Including but not limited to MS Windows).Strong computer and SmartPhone skills.· Ability to handle and properly use common power and hand tools (must own your own tools.)Ability to install cable (including fire-stop, terminate, test, troubleshoot, label and document test results).Commitment to maintain a safe, clean and organized work environment.Valid driver’s license with no infractions.Ability to carry heavy loads and climb ladders.Willingness to work in tight, confined areas (ceiling etc.).Willingness to work overtime when required.Commitment to excellence and quality work.Good communication and organization skills.Must have credit card to pay for expenses that will be reimbursed.Desired but NOT required Qualifications:Individuals with construction knowledge and/or running of low voltage wire in existing and/or new locations.Working knowledge of various types of security/video systems.Ability to interpret and apply blueprints, plans, CAD drawings, and specs.Ability to program access control systems and program changes to monitored systems.Ability to learn new technologies.Benefits:401K planHealth and dental planPaid Time OffOvertime payReimbursable Expenses If you have any further questions, please contact Mary Bergstraesser, Vice President of TotalKare of America, Inc. at 315-471-4477, x223 or via e-mail at mary@totalkare.com. Thank you!

Experience Level (if available): None
<JD_END>
